title: RAND President to Testify on Artificial Intelligence Before Senate Armed Services Subcommittee on Cybersecurity
descriptions: RAND President and CEO Jason Matheny will testify before the Senate Armed Services Subcommittee on Cybersecurity on Wednesday, April 19, during a hearing on artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning applications to enable cybersecurity.

image.desc: Robotic hand pressing a keyboard on a laptop, photo by Guillaume/Getty Images

sub_content.Who: RAND President and CEO Jason Matheny will testify before the Senate Armed Services Subcommittee on Cybersecurity on Wednesday, April 19, during a hearing on artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning applications to enable cybersecurity.

sub_content.What: Matheny's testimony will focus on how the Department of Defense (DoD) can best ensure that progress in AI benefits, rather than degrades, U.S. national security. He will also discuss China's goal to become the world's primary AI innovation driver by 2030 and how the militarization of AI technologies by both China and Russia may exacerbate national security challenges. Matheny will highlight specific actions that DoD could take in response to national security challenges, including tracking developments in AI that could affect cyber defense and cyber offense, preventing bad actors from having access to advanced AI systems, expanding intelligence on adversary states involved in AI, recruiting private-sector experts for government service, and investing in potential moonshots for AI security.

sub_content.Where:
Senate Russell Building, SR-222
